intro: Anychia nudiflora, commonly known as the naked-flower anychia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky slopes, thriving in cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in a fine layer of white hair, which helps reduce water loss. The flowers, which bloom in spring, are usually pale blue or white, and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
